title: Clopixol Depot 200MG Inj 1x1 (P)
details: This medication is used in the treatment of schizophrenia.
precautions: Before using it, tell your doctor or pharmacist if you are allergic to it; or if you have any other allergies. This product may contain inactive ingredients, which can cause allergic reactions or other problems. Talk to your pharmacist for more details. It may slow your reactions and make you feel drowsy. Do not drive and do not use tools or machines. Use with caution in patients who have heart or liver or kidney disorders. Before using it, tell your pharmacist or doctor your medical history, especailly of; epilepsy, depression, Parkinson's disease, raised pressure in your eye (glaucoma) or a condition which causes muscle weakness, called myasthenia gravis. Concurrent use of diuretics, lithium, Class Ia and III antiarrhythmics including amiodarone, sotalol, and quinidine ; some antipsychotics including thioridazine, some macrolides including erythromycin ; and some fluoroquinolones including moxifloxacin. Please consult your doctor when taking this medicine if you are pregnant
effects: Dizziness, dry mouth, constipation, swelling of breasts (in men and women), stuffy nose.

title: Zyprexa 10MG Tab 4x7 (L)
details:
Zyprexa tablets fall under the category of atypical antipsychotics treating psychotic conditions. They are also referred to as 2nd generation antipsychotics. Zyprexa generic name is ‘olanzapine’. The medication performs its mechanism by regulatin

precautions: The essential precautionary measures must be read before taking any medication. The precautions and warnings for Zyprexa tablets are listed below.Do not use the Zyprexa tablets if you are hypersensitive to any ingredients.It is recommended to notify your doctor of your medical history, medicines, and allergies you already have.Do not use the tablets if you suffer from glaucoma (an eye disorder).Notify your doctor if you experience unusual tongue or face movements.Zyprexa tablets are not prescribed for dementia patients as this drug can increase the risk of mortality.Drinking alcohol is not recommended while using the Zyprexa tablets.Monitor your weight as the tablets can cause weight gain.Keep checking your blood sugar, triglycerides, and cholesterol level regularly.Inform your doctor if you have a history or family history of blood clots, as the medication can increase the incidence of blood clots.Inform your doctor if you are taking medicines for Parkinson’s disease already.Inform your doctor if you are lactose intolerant before taking the medication.The medication can cause drowsiness if taken with any anti-depressant or tranquilizer.Do not use the tablets without a doctor’s prescription if you are pregnant or planning to be.The medication is not recommended during breastfeeding as it can pass into breast milk.Keep the medicine in a safe place.Tell your doctor/Pharmacist your medical history of, Liver problems, Seizures, Difficulty swallowing, Low white blood cell count, Dementia, Difficulty urinating due to enlarged prostate, Glaucoma, Chronic constipation, Paralytic ileus, Smoking, Personal or family history of Diabetes, Heart disease, High cholesterol/Triglyceride levels, Sleep apnea.
effects: The potential Zyprexa side effects are listed below. Consult a doctor immediately in case of any prolonged and extreme adverse effects.Dizziness, sleepiness, and laziness.Weight gain.Increased prolactin in the blood.Stomach upset.Weight gain.Blood clots.Abnormal face and tongue movements,An allergic reaction causes swelling in different parts of the body.Increased sugars, fats, and cholesterol are the olanzapine long-term side effects.Dry mouth.Constipation.Mood swings.Troubled urination.Troubled breathing.Rush to your consultant immediately if you experience liver or kidney damage, blood problems, heart dysfunction, or seizures.Drowsiness, Dizziness, Lightheadedness, Stomach upset, Dry mouth, Constipation, Increased appetite, or Weight gain may occur.
